intro: Elaphoglossum betancurii, commonly known as the Betancurii holly fern, is a species of fern native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a finely divided structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky or humus-rich soil. Its spores are produced in small, clustered sorus structures on the underside of the fronds. Elaphoglossum betancurii is valued for its ornamental appeal and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
